definitions: cheap fabric made from recycled wool fibers mixed with cotton
work or products of noticeably poor quality or careless construction
examples: The shoddy blanket fell apart after just one washing
Manufacturers used shoddy materials to cut production costs drastically
Their shoddy craftsmanship resulted in numerous customer complaints nationwide
The building's shoddy construction became evident during the inspection

definitions: protective covering for the human foot with a rigid sole
curved metal plate nailed to a horse's hoof for protection
part that presses against a wheel or drum in braking systems
examples: She bought comfortable walking shoes for her European vacation
The leather shoes needed polishing before the formal dinner
The blacksmith fitted new shoes on all four hooves
The horse threw a shoe while galloping through the field
The mechanic replaced the worn brake shoes on both wheels
Brake shoes press against the drum to slow the vehicle

definitions: person who makes or repairs shoes professionally as their primary occupation
examples: The village shoemaker repaired boots for three generations of families
A skilled shoemaker can create custom footwear from leather patterns

definitions: thin cord or string used to fasten and secure shoes to feet
very small or inadequate amount of money for operating or funding something
examples: His shoestring broke during the marathon race yesterday
She tied her shoestrings in a double knot
They started their business on a shoestring budget successfully
The nonprofit operates on a shoestring but serves hundreds

definitions: ram's horn blown as a musical instrument in Jewish religious ceremonies and High Holy Days
examples: The shofar sounded at sunset to mark Yom Kippur's end
Learning to blow the shofar requires practice and proper breathing

definitions: Japanese chess-like strategy board game played on a nine by nine grid with captured pieces returnable
examples: Professional shogi players compete in tournaments throughout Japan annually
He learned shogi from his grandfather during summer visits

definitions: hereditary military dictator who ruled Japan from 1192 to 1867 nominally under the emperor
examples: The Tokugawa shogun controlled Japan for over two centuries
Each shogun maintained power through a complex feudal system

definitions: government ruled by a shogun or the office and period of a shogun's rule in feudal Japan
examples: The Kamakura shogunate established the first warrior government system
During the shogunate period, samurai dominated Japanese society completely

definitions: traditional Japanese sliding door or room divider made of translucent paper over a wooden frame
examples: Sunlight filtered softly through the shoji screens at dawn
The architect incorporated shoji panels into the modern home design

definitions: set of staves and headings sufficient for assembling one barrel or cask when bound together
examples: The cooper ordered fifty shooks for the wine harvest season
Shooks were shipped disassembled to save transportation space efficiently

definitions: new growth sprouting from a plant stem or root system
organized session for taking photographs or filming scenes professionally
organized hunting trip or the land where game hunting occurs
examples: Bamboo shoots emerge rapidly during the spring growing season
The gardener pruned back shoots to encourage stronger growth
The fashion shoot lasted twelve hours in multiple locations
They scheduled the commercial shoot for early morning light
The grouse shoot attracted hunters from across the country
Lord Pemberton invited guests to his annual pheasant shoot

definitions: person who fires guns either professionally, recreationally, or in sports
small glass of straight liquor meant to be consumed quickly
large marble used to knock other marbles out of a circle
examples: The competitive shooter won three gold medals at nationals
Police identified the shooter from security camera footage clearly
She ordered tequila shooters for everyone at the bar
The bartender lined up rainbow-colored shooters on the counter
His prized shooter marble had unique swirls inside it
Choose your best shooter for this difficult bank shot

definitions: incident involving discharge of firearms resulting in injury or death
process of recording film, television, or photographic content professionally
organized hunting expedition where game birds or animals are shot
examples: The shooting incident prompted increased security measures campus-wide
Police investigated the shooting that occurred downtown yesterday
The movie shooting will close several streets next week
Bad weather delayed the outdoor shooting schedule significantly
The estate hosts shooting parties throughout the hunting season
Participants wore traditional tweeds for the grouse shooting

definitions: exchange of gunfire between opposing groups typically lasting several minutes
method of breaking ties in sports through alternating penalty attempts
examples: The Wild West shootout became legendary in frontier history
Police engaged suspects in a shootout lasting twenty minutes
The hockey game went to a shootout after overtime
She scored the winning goal in the penalty shootout

definitions: small retail store selling goods or providing services to customers
space equipped for manufacturing, repairing, or working with tools and machinery
classroom for teaching industrial arts, woodworking, or technical skills
examples: The corner shop sells newspapers and fresh bread daily
She opened an antique shop in the historic district
His woodworking shop contains every tool imaginable for carpentry
The auto shop repairs both foreign and domestic vehicles
Students learn welding techniques in the metal shop class
Shop class teaches practical skills alongside academic subjects

definitions: person who owns or manages a small retail shop as their primary business
examples: The friendly shopkeeper knew every customer by name personally
Local shopkeepers formed an association to promote downtown businesses

definitions: crime of stealing merchandise from a retail store during business hours while posing as a customer
examples: Security cameras help deter shoplifting in department stores significantly
The teenager was arrested for shoplifting cosmetics yesterday afternoon

definitions: person who visits stores to purchase goods or compare prices and products
examples: Holiday shoppers crowded the mall searching for perfect gifts
Smart shoppers compare prices online before making major purchases

definitions: activity of visiting stores to buy goods or browse merchandise
items that have been purchased or groceries bought from stores
examples: Online shopping has transformed retail business models completely
Weekend shopping at farmers markets supports local agriculture
She carried the shopping bags up three flights of stairs
Put the shopping away in the pantry and refrigerator

definitions: land along the edge of a sea, lake, or other large body of water
prop or beam used to support a structure temporarily during construction or repair
examples: Waves crashed against the rocky shore during the storm
Children collected seashells along the sandy shore yesterday
Workers installed shores to support the damaged wall temporarily
Steel shores prevented the excavation from collapsing during construction

definitions: the edge where a body of water meets the land, often changing with tides
examples: Erosion gradually changed the shoreline over several decades significantly
The development project must preserve the natural shoreline habitat

definitions: situation where available quantity falls below required or demanded levels causing scarcity
examples: The semiconductor shortage affected automobile production worldwide significantly
Water shortages forced communities to implement conservation measures immediately

definitions: fault, defect, or failure to meet a certain standard or expectation in performance
examples: Despite his many talents, procrastination remained his biggest shortcoming
The report highlighted several shortcomings in the safety protocols

definitions: route that is shorter than the usual one between two places
method or means of doing something more directly and quickly than usual
examples: The shortcut through the park saves ten minutes daily
Local residents know a shortcut avoiding the highway traffic
Keyboard shortcuts increase productivity when editing documents efficiently
There's no shortcut to mastering a musical instrument properly

definitions: solid fat used in baking to make pastries tender and flaky
act or process of making something shorter in length or duration
examples: The pie crust recipe calls for cold butter or shortening
Vegetable shortening creates flakier biscuits than oil does
The shortening of daylight hours signals autumn's arrival clearly
Budget constraints necessitated shortening the construction timeline considerably

definitions: amount by which something falls short of expectations, requirements, or targets financially
examples: The budget shortfall forced difficult decisions about program cuts
Unexpected expenses created a significant shortfall in quarterly earnings

definitions: method of rapid writing using symbols and abbreviations for words and phrases
shortened or simplified way of expressing or referring to something complex
examples: Court reporters use shorthand to record testimony verbatim quickly
She learned Gregg shorthand to take faster meeting notes
The term became shorthand for any technological disruption broadly
Using acronyms as shorthand saves time in technical documentation

definitions: list of selected candidates or options chosen from a larger group for final consideration
examples: Three candidates made the shortlist for the CEO position
The novel appeared on the shortlist for prestigious literary awards

definitions: defensive player positioned between second and third base in baseball responsible for fielding ground balls
examples: The shortstop made a spectacular diving catch yesterday afternoon
Playing shortstop requires quick reflexes and strong throwing ability

definitions: discharge of a firearm or the projectile fired from it
photograph taken or attempt to take a photograph quickly
injection of medicine or vaccine administered with a hypodermic needle
small serving of liquor typically consumed quickly in one swallow
attempt to score in sports like basketball or soccer
examples: The shot echoed through the valley at dawn
Several shots were fired during the confrontation yesterday
The photographer got a perfect shot of the sunset
That action shot captured the athlete mid-jump beautifully
The nurse administered the flu shot quickly and painlessly
Children need several shots before starting school enrollment
He ordered a shot of whiskey at the bar
They did shots to celebrate the promotion announcement
Her shot hit the rim and bounced away
The goalkeeper blocked every shot during the match

definitions: smoothbore firearm designed to fire shells containing multiple pellets or a single slug
front passenger seat in a vehicle next to the driver
examples: Hunters prefer shotguns for bird hunting and clay shooting
The farmer kept a shotgun for protecting livestock from predators
She called shotgun before anyone else reached the car
Riding shotgun means you control the radio station selection

definitions: joint between the arm and torso allowing arm movement and bearing weight
strip of land alongside a road for emergency stopping
cut of meat from the upper foreleg and shoulder blade area
sloping side of a mountain below the summit
examples: She injured her shoulder playing tennis last weekend
He carried the child on his shoulders through the crowd
Pull onto the shoulder if you have car trouble
The highway shoulder provides space for emergency vehicles
Slow-cooked pork shoulder makes excellent pulled pork sandwiches
The butcher recommended lamb shoulder for the stew
Climbers established camp on the mountain's shoulder overnight
The trail follows the shoulder before ascending the peak

definitions: loud cry or call expressing strong emotion or attracting attention across distance
examples: His victory shout echoed throughout the entire stadium
She heard a shout for help from the burning building

definitions: act of calling out loudly or the collective sound of many people yelling
examples: The shouting from the protest could be heard blocks away
Constant shouting damaged his vocal cords over time significantly

definitions: rough or careless push typically done with hands or body against someone
examples: An angry shove sent him stumbling backward unexpectedly
The crowd's shove nearly knocked her off balance completely

definitions: tool with a broad blade and handle used for lifting and moving loose material
examples: The snow shovel cleared the driveway in thirty minutes
Archaeologists use small shovels for delicate excavation work carefully

definitions: theatrical performance, television program, or entertainment spectacle for audiences
public exhibition or display of items, animals, or skills competitively
demonstration or outward display of qualities, emotions, or behaviors
examples: The Broadway show received standing ovations nightly
Her favorite TV show airs every Thursday evening
The annual flower show attracts gardeners from everywhere
Prize cattle competed at the agricultural show yesterday
His emotional show of support meant everything to her
The military show of force deterred potential conflicts

definitions: paddle wheel riverboat containing a theater for performances along river towns
person who performs ostentatiously to attract attention or admiration
examples: Historic showboats brought entertainment to isolated river communities
The restored showboat offers dinner theater cruises nightly
That showboat athlete celebrates excessively after every play
Nobody likes a showboat who constantly seeks the spotlight

definitions: glass case or cabinet for displaying valuable or interesting objects
event or medium for displaying someone's abilities or products favorably
examples: The museum showcase contained priceless ancient artifacts
Jewelry stores use locked showcases for expensive items
The festival serves as a showcase for emerging artists
The competition showcases young talent from across the nation

definitions: decisive confrontation or contest intended to settle a dispute once and for all
examples: The championship game became an epic showdown between rivals
The boardroom showdown determined the company's future direction completely

definitions: bathroom fixture that sprays water for washing the body while standing
brief period of rain or the falling of many small objects
party given to present gifts to someone before a major life event
examples: The hotel room had a luxurious rainfall shower head
She takes a quick shower every morning before work
Afternoon showers are common during the summer months
A meteor shower lit up the night sky spectacularly
Friends organized a surprise baby shower for the expectant mother
The bridal shower included games and gift opening ceremonies

definitions: female performer in elaborate costumes who dances or appears in musical productions, especially in Las Vegas
examples: The showgirl's feathered headdress weighed over twenty pounds
Former showgirls taught dance classes at the studio downtown

definitions: quality of performance or the impression made in a competition or test
scheduled viewing of a property for sale or a film screening
examples: The team's poor showing disappointed their dedicated fans greatly
Her strong showing in preliminaries earned a finals spot
The realtor scheduled three showings for Saturday afternoon
The midnight showing attracted devoted fans in costumes

definitions: person skilled at dramatic or entertaining presentation, especially in circus or theatrical performances
examples: P.T. Barnum was history's most famous circus showman
The veteran showman captivated audiences with theatrical flair

definitions: skill in dramatic or entertaining presentation designed to appeal to an audience
examples: His natural showmanship made every magic trick seem miraculous
Great showmanship distinguishes memorable performers from ordinary ones

definitions: outstanding example of something used for display or to impress others prominently
examples: The restored vintage car became his garage's showpiece
The new hospital serves as a showpiece for modern healthcare

definitions: large room used to display goods for sale, especially cars or furniture
examples: The car showroom featured the latest luxury models prominently
Customers browsed furniture displays in the spacious showroom

definitions: performance or item so impressive it brings prolonged applause interrupting the show
problem serious enough to halt progress or prevent something from proceeding
examples: Her solo number was the evening's undeniable showstopper
The finale featured a showstopper with full orchestra accompaniment
The software bug was a showstopper preventing product launch
Budget overruns became a showstopper for the construction project

definitions: scheduled time when a theatrical performance or movie screening begins
examples: Showtime is eight o'clock so arrive by seven-thirty
The theater posts showtimes for all movies playing today

definitions: fragments of a bomb, shell, or other object thrown out by an explosion
examples: Doctors removed shrapnel from the soldier's leg carefully
The blast sent shrapnel flying in all directions dangerously
